nodes.bodyText: instead of importing the color, does it work if the function being passed to withStyles have the theme object?

Technically we should be able to use Theme since at some point we wrap this in ThemeWrapper for the theme to be passed down the context. But our definition of colors in the theme is not right. Palette in material-ui is not defined to have colors the way we define.
Since I am still using the color used in the theme file, and even if we decide to change the color this directly gets affected. For now I would suggest let us have this. We need to fix the way we define colors in material-ui so that we could use the color we define directly from the theme without any hacks. Right now if I have to use the blue from the theme I have to type alias it to any (outline: '1px solid ${(theme.palette as any).blue[100]}')
combine the two if statements?
should we extract the types of properties that can be updated into an Enum?

Yeah should have done that from the beginning. I am extracting the strings like type names and will do this as well in a separate PR. It looks like I repeat strings in a lot of places that can be an enum.
I've noticed some types are in string form, should we define them in enum instead?
